level.text: An application for approval of the construction of a generating facility, transmission line or substation covered under this Chapter shall include the following information:
The name and address of the principal place of business of the applicant;
The name, title, and address of the person authorized to receive notices and communications with respect to the application;
The location or locations where the public may inspect or obtain a copy of the application;
A list of each District of Columbia, state, or federal government agency having authority to approve or disapprove the construction or operation of the project and containing the following:
A statement indicating whether the necessary approval from each agency has been obtained, with a copy of each approval or disapproval attached;
A statement indicating the circumstances under which any necessary approval has not been obtained; and
A statement indicating whether any waiver or variance has been requested, with a copy of each approval or disapproval attached.
A general description of the generating station under § 2102, or the transmission line under § 2104, and the alternatives considered under §§ 2103 and 2104, respectively;
The environmental information required under § 2108;
A statement of the engineering justifications for the project;
A statement of the safety considerations incorporated into the design, construction, and maintenance of the project;
A statement of the socioeconomic impact of the project;
A statement of contacts with community groups and the affected community;
A statement that the applicant has complied with all applicable environmental and zoning laws; and

A statement that the applicant has complied or will comply with the applicable PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. (PJM) tariff and requirements for the interconnection of new and expanded electric generating facilities within the PJM transmission system.
The original application shall be:
Signed by a person having authority with respect to the application and having knowledge of the application; and
Verified under oath.
All filings shall conform to the requirements of 15 DCMR Chapter 1. The Commission may, in its discretion, prescribe the form of the application.
In addition to filing the application with the Commission, the applicant shall simultaneously serve one copy on the following agencies:
The District of Columbia Office of the People’s Counsel;
The District of Columbia Department of Transportation;
The District of Columbia Corporation Counsel;
The Board of Zoning Adjustment;
The Office of Intergovernmental Relations;
The District of Columbia Energy Office;
The Metropolitan Washington Council of Governments, if affected;
The District of Columbia Zoning Commission;
The District of Columbia Office of Property Management;
The General Services Administration of the United States;
The Department of Consumer and Regulatory Affairs;
The Mayor’s Office of Policy and Education;
The U.S. Environmental Protection Agency-D.C. Field Office;
The National Capital Planning Commission
The District of Columbia Department of Health; and
PEPCO, if PEPCO is not the applicant.
The Advisory Neighborhood Commission(s) in which the generating facility or transmission line will be located.
The applicant shall also serve a copy of the application on any other District of Columbia or federal agency that may be affected.
The Commission shall publish notice of the application on its website.
Failure to comply with the provisions of this section may result in the summary rejection of the application.
